page.title: 16MR ASKEW'S FARMING LIFE.
page.content: There are 12 working farms in our area and 6 farmhouses which are not attached to farms.Most are arable farms.Few farmers in the area have livestock.We spoke to Christopher Askew about farming.He is an arable farmer.Mr Askew has 300 acres; his largest field is 44 acres and his smallest is 5.25 acres.Christopher Askew manages the farm with one part- time man.His grandfather started it for his son just before the second world war in 1939.When they first started they had one tractor which was 50hp,now tractors are 100hp.Mr.C.Askew grows Winter Wheat,Winter Barley,Peas and Potatoes.He harvests them by him- self with the part-time worker.Brick House Farm is a pig farm and The Hyde keeps cattle.Mr.C.Askew has 6 barns,2 are modern in which he stores grain and in the other 4 he keeps machinery.
